Gods

𒀭𒅎 ᵈAdad Haddu 𐎅𐎄 Haddad, Hatti (Storm God) < Seth 𓃩 כִּיּוּן > Hades
𒀭𒅎 ᵈAdad bynames Dadu, Dadda, Bir 𐎄
𒀭𒅎 Bearded Pidar 𓊪𓏏𓎛𓀭 (Petrus) 𐎄 𓊪𓅮𓄿𓏏𓏮𓏗 • Baᵈar > Baʿal Rapiu, Baal-Zephon
𒀭𒅎 Baal : Bull (god) “four horned radiant bull, your name is heaven” 𓊪𓏏𓇯

Rammanu ("Thunderer") cognate with Aramaic: רעמא Raˁmā and Hebrew: רַעַם Raˁam
His worship became widespread in Mesopotamia after the First Babylonian dynasty.
(The gods Enlil and Ninurta also had storm god features)

The Babylonian center of Adad/Iškur's cult was Karkara in the south, his chief temple being É.Kar.kar.a

On the one hand he is the god who, through bringing on the rain in due season, causes the land to become fertile, and, on the other hand, the storms that he sends out bring havoc and destruction.

𒀭𒅎 𓃩 ⇔ Dagan 𒀭𒁕𒃶 originally a weather-god

At Ebla (Tell Mardikh), from at least 2300 BC, Dagan was the head of the city pantheon comprising some 200 deities

𒅎 IM Amurru, the storm god of the Amorites.
